welcome:
Welcome to the Windows Automated General Servitor (WAGS)

To launch the assistant, hit the Run button below. 
Simply say 'WAGS' followed by a command, and WAGS will respond.

 Consult the features tab to see what WAGS can do for you!





If WAGS is running, the last thing he heard you say
will appear in the 'Last Command' section below.
features:
Here are all the functions WAGS can help you with!

Make sure that WAGS is running by hitting the green play button below,
and to always start by saying 'WAGS' then your command



---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[Greeting]

Say 'Hello' to WAGS and he will respond!

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[Open/Close Applications]

You can ask WAGS to open or close a specific appliction.


The apps that WAGS can open/close are:

(Internet Browsers)
Firefox, Google Chrome, Microsoft Edge

(Entertainment)
Spotify, Steam

(Communication)
Discord, Slack, Zoom

(Utility)
Snipping Tool, Visual Studio Code

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[Searching Topics]

WAGS can search up specific topics through Wikipedia. To use this function:
1. Ask WAGS to search for your topic (ex "Hey WAGS, what is Truman State University")
2. Navigate to the 'Wiki' tab on the side of this application. If the information has not
   refreshed, click the 'Wiki' tab button to refresh the page
3. Scroll through and read the information!

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[Notes]

WAGS can help you manage a collection of notes!
You can ask WAGS to perform the following actions regarding notes:
- Add a note        -Read a note
 - Edit a note        -Delete a note

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[Turning off computer]

WAGS has the ability to either log off or shut down your computer.
Just say "Hey WAGS, shut down/log off" and a confirmation window will appear.
Your computer will turn off after you have confirmed your choice!
wiki:
Ask WAGS to look something up and it will be displayed here! 

Try saying: "Hey WAGS, what is Truman State University?"

If you're expecting something to be displayed here that isn't,
press the 'Wiki' tab button on the left to refresh
tips:
Read these tips to increase your knowledge about Windows!

Combining these tips with WAGS' features, you'll be an expert at Windows
in no time!



---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[Keyboard Shortcuts]

Use these keyboard button combinations to perform their respective function:

Ctrl + C  -->  Copies selected item
Ctrl + V  -->  Pastes copied item
Ctrl + X  -->  Cuts selected item

Ctrl + Z  -->  Undo

Windows Key  -->  Open Windows search
Windows Key + I  -->  Open Windows settings
Ctrl + Shift + Esc  -->  Open task manager

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[Selecting a Microphone]

If you have a microphone but WAGS is telling you that they do not detect it
follow these steps to set one up!

1. Ensure the microphone is plugged into your computer
2. Press the Windows Key and type 'sound settings' in the search bar
3. When the settings open, find the drop down menu labeled
'Choose your input device'
4. Select your microphone from the list!

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[Browse Files and Folders]

The application 'Windows Explorer' is used to manage the files and folders
on your computer. If you can't find it, press the Windows Key and use the
search feature to launch it!

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[Updating Windows]

Make sure you are keeping Windows up to date to take advantage of all its
features. You can check for a Windows update by following these steps:

1. Press 'Windows Key + I' to open settings
2. Click on the 'Updates & Security' section
3. Click the 'Check for Updates' button
4. If an update appears, click 'Update' and wait
for your machine to finish!

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[Customizing the Start Menu]

The Start menu can be accessed by pressing the Windows key.
Use the below instructions to customize it to your liking!

1. Press 'Windows Key + I' to open settings
2. Click on the 'Personalization' section
3. On the left sidebar, select the 'Start' option
4. You can choose to turn on/off each option and
customize the window to your liking!

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[Customizing Windows Colors]

If you're unhappy with the overall color aesthetic of Windows,
you can customize it as well! Use the below instructions to
customize the colors of Windows

1. Press 'Windows Key + I' to open settings
2. Click on the 'Personalizaiton' section
3. On the left sidebar, select the 'Colors' option
4. The dropdown menu under the 'Choose your color' text
will allow you to change the overall theme of Windows
(light or dark)
5. The 'Choose your accent color' section below allows you
to change the accent color Windows will use on its menus
